isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - TURBOCHARGERS - RECONDITIONING - COMPONENT PARTS REPLACEMENT

step1.para:
Early Model T04B-25 turbochargers had a revised turbine wheel ( Figure 2.34
) and shaft assembly released to provide strengthened turbine blades.

figure.caption: Figure 2.34 New Style Turbine Wheel With 10° Cutback Blade Tip (Exducer).

note.para: THE REVISED TURBINE WHEEL AND SHAFT ASSEMBLY MUST NOT BE USED WITH 1.32 A/R HOUSINGS. ALSO, THE REVISED TURBINE WHEEL AND SHAFT ASSEMBLY DOES NOT APPLY TO THE 1.52 A/R TURBOCHARGER. SEE FIGURE 2.35. FOR A/R RATIO IDENTIFICATION.

step2.para: If T04B-25 turbochargers with 1.32 A/R turbine housings require turbine wheel and shaft assembly replacement, service with the new assembly and a 1.15 A/R ratio turbine housing.
See appropriate parts manual for service part numbers.

step1.para: All T04B turbochargers were improved with a revised turbine shaft seal ring, thrust collar and center housing assembly. These new items replace the earlier design parts without torque or tolerance change.

step2.para:
Lock plates (5 & 8, Figure 2.36
) and standard bolts used for fastening turbo compressor and center housings are replaced with self locking hex-head bolts (4 & 7). The new self locking bolts eliminate the need for lock plates. New bolts (4) on the compressor housing side are used with previous clamps (12).

note.para: When replacing compressor housing lockplate P/N 630 609 C1, all three (3) lock plates and (6) 5/16 x 1/2 in. standard bolts, 18763 R1 must & replaced with six (6) new self locking bolts, 1 809 618 C1. Torque new bolts to 150 lb-in. (16.9 Nm).

When replacing center housing lock plate P/N 625 675 C1, both lock plates and (4) 1/4 x 5/8 in. standard bolts, 25 480 R1, must be replaced with four (4) new self locking flanged bolts, 1 809 617 C1. Torque new bolts to 117.5 lb-in. (13.3 Nm).
Lock plates and bolts used for fastening turbine housing are still required, they did not change.
